title: Varicose veins
summary: Varicose veins, also known as varicoses, are a medical condition in which superficial veins become enlarged and twisted.[2][1] These veins typically develop in the legs, just under the skin.[3] Varicose veins usually cause few symptoms. However, some individuals may experience fatigue or pain in the area.[2] Complications can include bleeding or superficial thrombophlebitis.[2][1] Varices in the scrotum are known as a varicocele, while those around the anus are known as hemorrhoids.[1] Due to the various physical, social, and psychological effects of varicose veins, they can negatively affect one's quality of life.[5]
